must_have_skills: Experience in healthcare or other regulated environments
nice_to_have_skills: Agentic AI frameworks (AutoGen, CrewAI, Semantic Kernel)
jd.notes_for_resume:
- Lead with production ML/LLM deployments, especially NLP/GenAI use cases (summarization, intelligent assistants, document processing) and the business impact achieved.
- Detail RAG implementations: embeddings strategy, chunking, retrieval quality, and vector DBs used (Pinecone/Weaviate/FAISS), including latency, accuracy, and cost metrics.
- Highlight Python expertise and ML stack (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Hugging Face, scikit-learn) with concrete project outcomes.
- Showcase API development and system integration work; note contributions across the full stack and secure, scalable deployments.
- Describe MLOps/LLMOps practices you implemented: CI/CD, model/version management, monitoring, retraining triggers, and governance controls.
- Specify cloud experience across AWS and Azure for training, inference, and orchestration; mention relevant services and infrastructure choices.
- Emphasize healthcare/regulated environment experience and compliance (HIPAA/GDPR/FDA), including privacy, security, and audit practices.
- Include examples of mentoring/coaching engineers and partnering with product/business teams to translate requirements into AI solutions.
- Quantify model performance and impact (e.g., accuracy, F1/ROUGE, latency, throughput, cost savings, user adoption).
- If applicable, list experience with LangChain, LlamaIndex, and agentic/multi-agent frameworks.

profile.headline: Machine Learning Engineer / AI Engineer

experience.title: Systems Analyst, FWA POC
bullets: Built an enterprise-ready FWA analytics POC for Michigan Medicaid FFS across Redshift, SageMaker, Glue, and Bedrock.
Developed an SQL library spanning claim headers, lines, diagnoses, procedures, and provider metadata for feature extraction.
Engineered Redshift + Glue pipelines to compute provider/member/claim risk indicators and utilization outliers.
Integrated SDOH datasets (CDC SVI, BRFSS, USDA, RWJF, NCHS) with member geography for contextual risk signals.
Prototyped anomaly detection workflows in SageMaker (statistical outliers, density-based clustering, temporal deviation).
Designed LLM-powered investigation agents on AWS Bedrock for NL querying, summarization, and FWA insight generation.
Implemented Redshift-optimized validation and transformations to improve data quality and performance.
Collaborated with SMEs to translate Medicaid rules into AI-ready features and inference logic.
Delivered reusable query/feature templates and architectural documentation for the fraud analytics platform.
skills: SDOH datasets (CDC SVI, BRFSS, USDA, RWJF, NCHS)

experience.title: Systems Analyst, Audit Studio ND, ClaimsSure, MI Operations
bullets: Converted business requirements into technical solutions and integrated data sources into staging for AuditStudio.
Executed SURS scenarios; analyzed results and tuned weights; evaluated measures using PCA and KMeans.
Orchestrated parallel Spark jobs per scenario and exported scenario data to S3 for downstream consumption.
Resolved data quality issues with stakeholders and ensured timely release deployments and scenario extracts.
Managed release processes for Java code, PL/SQL, and database objects to source control.
Designed system architecture and developed web applications/services using Java Spring.
Implemented PL/SQL packages and db2db jobs to enable efficient inter-database transfers.
Managed inbound/outbound interfaces, conducted testing, and deployed to production.
Communicated with Michigan state users to gather requirements and align with business needs.

experience.title: Senior QA Engineer, CHAMPS Claims & ClaimsSure
bullets: Validated ClaimsSure scenarios, measures, thresholds, and coefficients for improper billing detection.
Verified Logistic Regression-based flagging against derived coefficients and configured thresholds.
Developed Selenium automation and complex SQL queries for claims data testing.
Tested HIPAA EDI transactions including Claims, Encounters, PA, and Eligibility.
Coordinated with developers on defect fixes and enhancements; improved QA processes.

experience.title: Senior Associate Consultant
bullets: Enhanced the Encounter system to meet organizational, state, and CMS guidelines.
Developed BRDs and traceability matrices; supported UAT and QA.
Improved encounter processing and reconciliation of CMS/state response files.

experience.title: Senior Associate Consultant
bullets: Configured and enhanced the Open Health Plus (OH+) application based on business needs.
Developed/enhanced PL/SQL stored procedures, triggers, and views.
Coordinated with release management for successful releases.

experience.title: Testing Engineer
bullets: Automated FedEx eDD solution and integrated with other FedEx systems.
Managed test team and conducted knowledge transition sessions.
Created high-level test scenarios and led document walkthroughs.

experience.title: Programmer
bullets: Supported HealthPAS System and Integration Testing for the state of Idaho.
Developed tools to automate provider credentialing and test management processes.

education: Bachelor of Sciences, Mathematics-Physics-Electronics; Nizam College, Hyderabad, Telangana; 2007.

tailored.resume_text:
Narender Surabhi
Senior Machine Learning Engineer / AI Engineer
Phone: +1(213) 254-8205 | Email: narender.surabhi@acentra.com

Summary
Senior ML/AI Engineer with 18 years in healthcare analytics and Medicaid systems, delivering NLP/LLM and ML solutions on AWS (SageMaker, Bedrock, Redshift, Glue, S3). Built FWA analytics and LLM-powered investigation agents, and productionized data pipelines with Spark, SQL, and Java Spring APIs. Strong in RAG workflows, vector search (FAISS), CI/CD and releases, and HIPAA-compliant system integration; experienced mentoring teams and aligning with business and regulatory requirements.

Skills
- LLMs & NLP: LLM summarization; RAG workflows; Vector search (FAISS); LangChain
- Machine Learning & Analytics: Regression, Classification, Clustering; PCA, KMeans, Logistic Regression; Anomaly detection; Healthcare analytics & FWA/SURS
- AWS & Data Platforms: Amazon SageMaker, AWS Bedrock; AWS Glue, Amazon Redshift, Amazon S3; Apache Spark; SQL
- Engineering & MLOps: Python, Java, PL/SQL; Java Spring (APIs & services); CI/CD & source control (Jenkins); Data validation & quality
- Healthcare & Compliance: Medicaid systems (CHAMPS, ClaimsSure); HIPAA EDI; SDOH data integration

Experience
Acentra Health — Systems Analyst, FWA POC (Okemos, Michigan)  Apr 2025 – Aug 2025
- Built an enterprise-ready FWA analytics POC across Amazon Redshift, SageMaker, Glue, and Bedrock for Michigan Medicaid FFS.
- Engineered Redshift + Glue pipelines to compute provider/member/claim risk indicators and utilization outliers.
- Developed an SQL feature library spanning claims headers/lines, diagnoses, procedures, and provider metadata.
- Integrated SDOH datasets (CDC SVI, BRFSS, USDA, RWJF, NCHS) with member geography to enrich contextual risk signals.
- Prototyped anomaly detection workflows in SageMaker, including statistical outliers, density-based clustering, and temporal deviation.
- Designed LLM-powered investigation agents on AWS Bedrock for natural language querying and summarization to accelerate FWA insights.
- Implemented Redshift-optimized validations and transformations to improve data quality and query performance.

Acentra Health — Systems Analyst, Audit Studio ND, ClaimsSure, MI Operations (Okemos, Michigan)  Jan 2023 – Present
- Translated Michigan state user requirements into technical designs and staged integrated data sources for AuditStudio.
- Executed and tuned SURS scenarios; evaluated measures using PCA and KMeans to refine detection accuracy.
- Orchestrated parallel Spark jobs per scenario and exported scenario outputs to Amazon S3 for downstream consumption.
- Designed and developed Java Spring web applications/services for internal APIs and system components.
- Managed release processes and source control for Java, PL/SQL, and database objects; coordinated timely deployments and extracts.
- Built PL/SQL packages and db2db jobs for inter-database transfers; resolved data quality issues across interfaces.

CNSI — Senior QA Engineer, CHAMPS Claims & ClaimsSure (Lansing, Michigan)  Dec 2016 – Jan 2023
- Verified Logistic Regression-based improper billing detection by validating ClaimsSure scenarios, measures, thresholds, and coefficients.
- Built Selenium automation and complex SQL queries for claims data testing, improving coverage and speed.
- Tested HIPAA EDI transactions (Claims, Encounters, PA, Eligibility) and collaborated with developers to resolve defects.

Infosys Limited — Senior Associate Consultant (Los Angeles, CA)  Dec 2015 – Dec 2016
- Enhanced the Encounter system to meet organizational, state, and CMS guidelines in a regulated Medicaid environment.
- Developed BRDs and traceability matrices; supported UAT and QA with business and technical stakeholders.

Infosys Limited — Senior Associate Consultant (Pune, MH, India)  Sep 2013 – Dec 2015
- Configured and enhanced the Open Health Plus (OH+) application to meet evolving business needs.
- Developed PL/SQL stored procedures, triggers, and views; coordinated with release management for successful deployments.

Syntel Limited — Testing Engineer (Pune, India)  Aug 2010 – Sep 2013
- Automated the FedEx eDD solution and integrated it with related FedEx systems to streamline testing workflows.
- Led a test team, created high-level test scenarios, and conducted knowledge transition sessions.

Cognizant — Programmer (Hyderabad, India)  Sep 2007 – Aug 2010
- Supported Idaho HealthPAS system and integration testing; built tools to automate provider credentialing and test management processes.

Certifications
- AWS Certified AI Practitioner (AIF-C01), Amazon Web Services, 2025

Education
- Nizam College — Bachelor of Sciences, Mathematics-Physics-Electronics, 2007 (Hyderabad, Telangana)

issues.message: No evidence of TensorFlow experience, a core framework requirement.
No evidence of PyTorch experience, a core framework requirement.
No evidence of Hugging Face ecosystem usage (Transformers/Datasets/PEFT).
scikit-learn not mentioned despite classical ML techniques being referenced.
No clear demonstration of deploying ML/LLM solutions to production; LLM work is described as a POC.
issues.location_hint: Experience: Acentra Health — Systems Analyst, FWA POC

issues.message: MLOps/LLMOps practices (monitoring, model/version management, retraining, governance) are not described.
Embeddings capability is not explicitly stated (models, dimensions, normalization), only vector search/FAISS implied.
RAG implementation details (chunking, retrieval quality, re-ranking, vector DB metrics) are not provided.
issues.location_hint: Experience: Acentra Health — Systems Analyst, FWA POC

issues.message: Compliance coverage limited to HIPAA; no GDPR/FDA evidence.
API development is shown in Java Spring; lack of Python ML serving APIs may be a mismatch for typical ML stacks.
issues.location_hint: Experience: Acentra Health — Audit Studio; Skills: Engineering & MLOps

issues.message: Model performance and business impact metrics (e.g., ROUGE/F1, recall@k, latency/throughput, cost) are not quantified.
issues.location_hint: Experience: FWA POC and Audit Studio

issues.message: Mentoring/coaching claims are light on specifics (scope, number of mentees, outcomes).

suggestions: Add concrete experience with TensorFlow and/or PyTorch (training/inference, fine-tuning, deployment) and summarize model types and outcomes.
Highlight Hugging Face usage (Transformers, Datasets, PEFT/LoRA) with specific models, tasks, and throughput/latency metrics.
Explicitly list scikit-learn for PCA/KMeans/Logistic Regression and describe pipelines, cross-validation, and results.
Detail embeddings: model(s) used (e.g., Bedrock Titan, OpenAI), vector dimension, normalization, similarity metric, and ANN index parameters.
Expand RAG implementation: chunk size/overlap, retriever top-k, re-ranking, caching, evaluation (precision/recall@k), and FAISS index type; add Pinecone/Weaviate experience if available.
Provide examples of production ML/LLM deployments (SageMaker endpoints, Bedrock agents/guardrails) with deployment strategy (blue/green/canary), autoscaling, and rollback.
Document MLOps/LLMOps: CI/CD for models (model registry, MLflow/DVC), monitoring (data drift, hallucination rate), retraining triggers, lineage/governance, and access controls.
Add Azure experience or projects (Azure ML, AKS, ACR, Azure OpenAI, Cosmos DB) to meet multi-cloud requirements.
Strengthen compliance coverage beyond HIPAA (GDPR/FDA) or clarify scope; include PHI handling, encryption, audit logging, DLP, and privacy-by-design practices.
Quantify impact: accuracy/F1/ROUGE, recall@k, P50/P95 latency, throughput, and cost per 1k tokens; tie to business outcomes (savings, hours saved).
Include Python API serving experience (FastAPI/Flask) for ML inference, with auth (OAuth2/JWT), rate limiting, and observability (OpenTelemetry/Prometheus).
Mention vector database trade-offs and experience beyond FAISS (Pinecone/Weaviate), including latency/cost benchmarks and scaling patterns.
Provide concrete mentoring/coaching examples (number of mentees, code reviews, knowledge shares) and engineering standards you established.
